info.title: Eryxon Flow API
info.description:
Production workflow management API for sheet metal manufacturing. This API allows you to manage jobs, parts, tasks, and track production progress through various stages.

## Authentication

All API requests require an API key. Include your API key in the `Authorization` header:

```
Authorization: Bearer ery_live_your_api_key_here
```

## Getting Started

1. **Generate an API Key**: Navigate to Admin > API Keys in the web interface
2. **Test the Connection**: Use the `/api-stages` endpoint (read-only) to verify your key works
3. **Create Your First Job**: Use POST `/api-jobs` to create a job with parts and tasks
4. **Track Progress**: Use GET endpoints to retrieve and monitor job status

## Rate Limiting

API requests are rate-limited to prevent abuse. Rate limit information is included in response headers:
- `X-RateLimit-Limit`: Maximum requests allowed
- `X-RateLimit-Remaining`: Remaining requests in current window
- `X-RateLimit-Reset`: Timestamp when the limit resets

## Base URL

```
https://vatgianzotsurljznsry.supabase.co/functions/v1
```

post.description:
Generate a pre-signed URL for uploading files to cloud storage. Use the returned URL to upload your file directly.

## Upload Process

1. Call this endpoint with the filename and content type
2. Receive a signed URL and file path
3. Use the signed URL to upload your file (PUT request)
4. Store the file path in your job/part metadata

filename.description: Name of the file (no path traversal allowed)

upload_url.description: Pre-signed URL for uploading (valid for 60 seconds)

file_path.description: Path to store in your records

put.summary: Sync a single job from ERP
put.description: Upsert a job by external_id. Creates new job if external_id doesn't exist, updates if it does. Supports nested parts and operations.

with_parts.summary: Sync job with nested parts and operations

post.description: Upsert up to 1000 jobs in a single request. Each job is processed individually with its own success/error status.

put.summary: Sync a single part from ERP
put.description: Upsert a part by external_id. Requires job_external_id to link to parent job.

post.description: Upsert up to 1000 parts. Requires job_external_id for each part to resolve parent job.

put.summary: Sync a single operation from ERP
put.description: Upsert an operation by external_id. Requires part_external_id and cell_name.

post.description: Upsert up to 1000 operations. Requires part_external_id and cell_name for each.

get.description: Retrieve tools, fixtures, molds, and equipment with optional filtering.

put.summary: Sync a single resource from ERP
Sync a single cell/work center from ERP

post.summary: Bulk sync cells/work centers from ERP

post.description: Check what would change when syncing data from ERP without making any modifications. Returns status for each record (create, update, unchanged, error). Use this for incremental sync validation before executing.
Sync jobs, parts, and resources in a single request. Automatically skips unchanged records via sync_hash comparison. Supports batch operations with detailed results per record.

get.description: View sync history and statistics for auditing and troubleshooting.

metadata.description: Custom key-value pairs for additional data

file_paths.description: Array of file paths from upload endpoint

parts.description: Nested parts to sync with the job

job_external_id.description: External ID of parent job (required for flat sync)

part_external_id.description: External ID of parent part (required for flat sync)

action.description: Whether record was created or updated

id.description: Internal UUID of the synced record
